availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leon Kahn (Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker, merchant, and auctioneer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker, merchant, and auctioneer. Native of France. Son of Emanuel Kahn. Married to Sarah Grauman Kahn in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1860. Father of David Kahn, Esther Kahn, and Emanuel Kahn. Boot and shoemaker in Louisville in 1858. Auctioneer and commercial merchant in partnership with Isadore Grauman in L. Kahn & Company in Louisville from 1860 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Marion County, Indianapolis, District 1, p. 19B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709.

The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), March 27, 1860, p. 3.
"Special and Large Auction Sale," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), January 22, 1863, p. 3.
"Pneumonia Fatal to Aged Retired Merchant," The Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), February 9, 1912, p. 4.
Louisville City Directory and Business Mirror for 1858-9, (Louisville: Hurd & Burrows, 1859), 95.
